title: Is this how it's supposed to be? (Draft)
body:
Two people out of the party of three get the roles they want automatically if they choose the same two roles in the party of three.

Is this how it's supposed to be or no??? 

Just a question.

replies.body: I'm not sure I really understand the question.  Players should be able to select whichever queue they want, unless it's a full group.  The role you receive upon accepting a match is not guaranteed, but will certainly try to get you in your primary role.  Hope that helps!

I believe he's saying you queue up as 3

Player 1 selects Jungle/Top
Player 2 selects Jungle/top
Player 3 selects Mid/ADC

Your tri queue is guaranteed Jungle/top
Exactly! My friend wanted jg so he has his primary on jg and secondary on top, I wanted top so i have my primary on top and my secondary as jg, then we both get the roles we want. Is it normal?
It's just pretty much another way Rito gives a big "screw you" to solo players through Dynamic Queue lol.

More generally, the rules are that a Duo must cover at least 3 positions (with Secondary positions included), a Trio must cover 4 positions, a Quad must cover 5, and a full team is guaranteed to have whatever they want (obviously).

Yes, 'cause it works only for Trio (or more), and the third guy has to sacrifice in order for you to do that. He cannot pick Jung or Top as his secondary, and he's forced to take 2 completely different positions than yourself.
As long as you have 1 more role selected than the amount of people in your party, it works.
